Key Match Events: The Kings went on a 17-2 run to end the third quarter and take an 83-77 lead.
Sacramento started the fourth on an 11-4 run, extending the lead to double digits on a 3-pointer by Trey Lyles.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks were without their top three scorers but kept the game close until the fourth.
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings snapped a six-game losing streak, fending off an 18-point, first-quarter deficit and early boos from the home crowd for a desperately needed win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Domantas Sabonis had 17 points and 17 assists.
Spencer Dinwiddie and PJ Washington both had season highs for the Mavericks. Dinwiddie scored 30 points and Washington had 28.
Others: The Mavericks were without Kyrie Irving (shoulder), Klay Thompson (illness), Dereck Lively II (hip) and Naji Marshall (suspension).
Luka Doncic was out for at least the next month with a calf strain.
Trailing by nine in the third quarter, the Kings turned around what had been a listless performance.
After allowing the Lakers to shoot 60% from the field on Saturday, the Kings held the Mavericks to 40 second-half points.
